text: Russell H. Jackman (born c. 1929) was a Canadian curler. He was the lead of the 1953 Brier Champion team (skipped by Ab Gowanlock), representing Manitoba. A member of the Dauphin, Manitoba Elks of Canada branchhttp://www.elks- canada.org/uploads/File/history/History-Part5.pdf He served as "Grand Exalted Ruler" of the organization from 1974 to 1975.http://www.elks- canada.org/uploads/File/history/History-Part1.pdf He was inducted into the Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame in 2019.https://www.winnipegfreepress.com/our- communities/sports/Sports-hall-of-fame-honours-veteran-athletes-511468582.html ==References== Category:Brier champions Category:Curlers from Manitoba Category:Sportspeople from Dauphin, Manitoba Category:Canadian male curlers Category:1920s births Category:living people Category:Year of birth uncertain
title: Russ Jackman
